Standard of Care

“Standard of Care” is a legal term and it refers to the standard that the courts will hold a person to when they examine the person’s judgement, actions (or lack of action), etc. should a serious incident occur.

 

The standard of care is what the CAF member ought to do in a given situation to care for the people or materiel in their charge. It is an obligation to exercise the same level of care that a reasonable person with similar abilities, skills and experience would in a similar circumstance. All adults are all credited with the same general intelligence and sensibility, and thus the law expects each adult to behave in a reasonable fashion when confronted with similar circumstances.

 

The standard of care includes following policies, as well as making decisions that aren’t necessarily covered by a written policy (using judgement to interpret the intention of the policy or the instructions from your chain of command).
